lines.text: Who in the world would think of looking for the famous terrorist Miguel inside an American penitentiary?
You didn't expect to fool an old jungle fighter with a boomerang trick like that, did you?

[Captain America has just apprehended a hoodlum who's been hassling some elderly people]
I want your number when you get out of jail pal! The old people in this town are my friends. And if I hear they're having problems again, I'm comin' after you! You gota that!
I've got it. I've got it.
I want the name of every member of your gang.

[sketching a portrait of an old lady]
Mrs. Shaw, you have the eyes of Farrah Fawcett and a face like Julie Christie.
Miguel, the revolutionary?
The man behind the airport slaughter at Copenhagen, the massacre at the World Cup Track meet and most of the kidnapings and executions of diplomats all over Europe.
We have reason to believe that these are all pictures of Miguel.
Looks like six different men, Simon. Who is he really? I mean, what's his background? Is he really a general?
No one seem to know. I've heard stories that he's the son of a French Count. De DeMontray I think.
Or that he's actually a Dutch physician named Van Hooten. Or an Englishman named Thornton.

[holding a lion cub]
But we can run a few tests on this little fellow and have an answer shortly.
You'll have a scientific answer. You people have it easy. Two and two always ad up. I have to make a policital decision.
How's your memory for numbers, Peter?
Better than Duke Williams!
What stories you're going to be able to tell, Millicent. Imagine, having a twin sister who's a whole month older than you are.
Miguel?
Too late, Stader. He died of old age waiting for you.
How big a dose of the aging formula did you get?
Very little. Not enough for the side effect. Ilson guessed I aged about three weeks.
Minor flesh wound in the service of your country.
